title: Social Platforms Duck Blame for Inflaming Divisions Before Charlie Kirk’s Death
summary: After authorities said Mr. Kirk’s suspected shooter had been “radicalized” online, Meta, Reddit, TikTok and other platforms have stayed quiet — though not Elon Musk, who owns X.

title: How the Government Is Trying to Silence Charlie Kirk’s Critics
summary: We look at the fight over free speech.

title: Robert Redford, Screen Idol Turned Director and Activist, Dies at 89
summary: He made serious topics like grief and political corruption resonate with the masses, in no small part because of his own star power.

title: As an Activist, Robert Redford Understood the Power of Celebrity
summary: His knowledge of the ways cameras and media create narratives helped him redirect those stories in service of larger causes like environmentalism.

title: Robert Redford: A Life in Photos
summary: The Oscar-winning director, who preferred life away from Hollywood, was once a sex symbol and later an activist who used his celebrity to draw attention to the environment.

title: Robert Redford: 15 Memorable Movies to Stream
summary: His roles brought him to the screen as a Depression-era con man, a governor’s son and the journalist Bob Woodward. He also took to the director’s chair. Here are some of Redford’s career highlights.

title: State Terrorism Charges Against Luigi Mangione Are Dismissed
summary: The judge overseeing the case against Mr. Mangione said the evidence underpinning two of the most serious counts, one of which charged him with first-degree murder, was “legally insufficient.”

title: Howard Lutnick, the Pierre Hotel and Claims of a Secret Plan
summary: Some residents of the Pierre claim that Howard Lutnick, who owns the penthouse, was part of a plot to sell off this symbol of Manhattan glamour and wealth.

title: F.B.I. Agents Fired by Patel Speak Out on ‘Broken’ Trust
summary: The two agents’ accounts offer an inside view of a bureau buffeted by politics and upheaval, adding to the scrutiny of the F.B.I. director as he prepares to testify to Congress.

title: Trump Sues The New York Times For Articles Questioning His Success
summary: The lawsuit, filed by the president in federal court in Florida, claims The Times defamed him and sought to undermine his campaign in the 2024 election.

title: National Parks to Remove Some Materials on Slavery and Tribes
summary: The Trump administration ordered a Civil War-era war image removed from a National Park site in Georgia as it moves to promote what it considers a more positive view of American history.

title: Cassidy, His Job in Peril, Scrutinizes Kennedy on Vaccines
summary: Senator Bill Cassidy, a Republican physician and vaccine proponent who is facing a primary challenge from the right, has a fraught relationship with the health secretary.

title: Joe Manchin Would Like a Word. (OK, Maybe Several Words.)
summary: The voluble former senator, now retired from politics, appears to miss the arena and is mulling a return to it.

title: Johnson Releases Spending Bill, Daring Democrats to Oppose It
summary: The speaker put forward a stopgap bill to fund the government past Sept. 30, saying there was “zero chance” he would add concessions Democrats have demanded.

title: California’s Environmental Past Confronts Economic Worries of the Present
summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom and Democratic state lawmakers have focused on pocketbook concerns this year, seeing their party’s national losses as a reckoning.

title: California’s High Gas Prices Could Climb Further as Refineries Close
summary: The state has led the country in adopting electric cars and reducing gas use, but it now faces much higher gas prices as oil companies plan to shut down refineries.

title: Carl Heastie, Another Democratic Holdout, Is Expected to Endorse Mamdani
summary: Mr. Heastie, the speaker of the New York State Assembly, is one of several prominent Democrats who had resisted backing Zohran Mamdani, the party’s nominee for New York City mayor.

title: What Exactly Are A.I. Companies Trying to Build? Here’s a Guide.
summary: Amazon, Microsoft, Google, Meta and OpenAI plan to spend at least $325 billion by the end of the year in pursuit of A.I. We explain why they’re doing it.

title: How Wall Street’s Big Bets on A.I. Are Driving Interest in Huge Parking Lots
summary: J.P. Morgan, Blackstone and other financial giants are buying “industrial outdoor storage,” sites vital to logistics, trade and the construction of data centers.

title: He Fled Putin’s War. The U.S. Deported Him to a Russian Jail.
summary: Antiwar Russians are being sent back as part of President Trump’s immigration crackdown, despite facing imprisonment and other dangers.

title: Russia Indoctrinates Children From Occupied Ukraine at 210 Sites, Study Says
summary: War crime investigators at Yale discovered a program of re-education and military and police training that was larger than estimated earlier.

title: What a No-Fly Zone Over Ukraine Would Mean for the West
summary: Poland suggested such a zone after a major Russian incursion. But political hesitance and military shortcomings pose clear obstacles.

title: 20 Years Ago, Alinea Electrified Chicago Dining. Does It Still Matter?
summary: At this famously innovative restaurant, our critic finds a mix of thought-provoking experiments and empty spectacle.

title: The Kirk Crackdown Is Underway
summary: The idea that there is more left-wing extremist violence than right-wing extremist violence is a dangerous myth.

title: We Are Going to Have to Live Here With Each Other
summary: Ben Shapiro and I discuss the state — and stakes — of political disagreement in America.

title: Late Night Finds Trump Strangely Fascinated by the White House Ballroom
summary: “Every time he gets a chance to talk about it, he sounds likes one of my kids,” Seth Meyers said.

title: Fani Willis Loses Bid to Continue Prosecuting Georgia Trump Case
summary: The 4-3 ruling means that the criminal case against President Trump, related to his efforts to overturn his 2020 election loss, will not move forward anytime soon, if ever.

title: Why a Pennsylvania Court Election This November Could Matter in 2028
summary: Voters will decide whether three Democratic State Supreme Court justices will keep their seats in a swing state that will be crucial to the next presidential election.

title: YouTube Expands its Livestreaming Tools In Push for More Live Video
summary: The world’s largest and most influential video platform wants to persuade a lot more content creators to broadcast live.

title: New Research Helps Explain Gas Craters in Siberia
summary: Spontaneous gas explosions appear to be increasing in northern Russia because of climate change and some specific local conditions.
